title: Austria Disrupts Taylor Swift Concert Attack Plot, Seizes Chemicals
content: A 19-year-old Austrian terrorism suspect had taken concrete steps in planning an attack on a Taylor Swift concert, with chemical substances found during a search of his residence, Austria's general director for public security said.
summary: A 19-year-old Austrian terrorism suspect had taken concrete steps in planning an attack on a Taylor Swift concert, with chemical substances found during a search of his residence, Austria's general director for public security said.

title: Largest 3D Printed Neighbourhood In The World Nears Completion In Texas
content: This summer, the robotic printer from ICON is finishing the last few of 100 3D-printed houses in Wolf Ranch, a community in Georgetown, Texas, about 30 miles from Austin.
summary: This summer, the robotic printer from ICON is finishing the last few of 100 3D-printed houses in Wolf Ranch, a community in Georgetown, Texas, about 30 miles from Austin.

title: 6.9 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Japan. Tsunami Alert Issued
content: An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.1 hit southwestern Japan on Thursday, triggering tsunami advisories, public broadcaster NHK reported, but there were no immediate signs of major damage.
summary: An earthquake with a magnitude of 7.1 hit southwestern Japan on Thursday, triggering tsunami advisories, public broadcaster NHK reported, but there were no immediate signs of major damage.

title: Dell To Layoff Workers In Sales Team Reorganization With New AI-Focused Unit
content: Dell previously announced a major workforce reduction in early 2023, shedding 13,000 jobs in that fiscal year.
summary: Dell previously announced a major workforce reduction in early 2023, shedding 13,000 jobs in that fiscal year.

title: How $1.4M Watch Captures Albania's History: Explained
content: Albanian jeweller Pirro Ruco laboured day and night for five years to capture the essence of his country in a spectacular luxury watch.
summary: Albanian jeweller Pirro Ruco laboured day and night for five years to capture the essence of his country in a spectacular luxury watch.

title: Microbes Have Adapted To Microwave Ovens, Finds Study. How To Disinfect.
content: Microwave ovens harbour specialised communities of highly adapted microbes, according to a new study.
summary: Microwave ovens harbour specialised communities of highly adapted microbes, according to a new study.

title: Luana Alonso, Swimmer Kicked Out Of Olympics For "Inappropriate" Conduct
content: Luana Alonso, a 20-year-old swimmer from Paraguay, was asked to leave the Olympic Village for allegedly creating an "inappropriate" environment.
summary: Luana Alonso, a 20-year-old swimmer from Paraguay, was asked to leave the Olympic Village for allegedly creating an "inappropriate" environment.

title: Where Will Sheikh Hasina Go? Bangladesh Ex-PM's Options After Dhaka Exit
content: Two days back, Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh Prime Minister, fled capital Dhaka amid violent protests demanding her ouster and landed near Delhi.
summary: Two days back, Sheikh Hasina resigned as Bangladesh Prime Minister, fled capital Dhaka amid violent protests demanding her ouster and landed near Delhi.

title: "Vice President Doesn't Answer Questions": JD Vance Slams Kamala Harris
content: Republican vice-presidential candidate and Ohio Senator JD Vance tried to confront Vice President Kamala Harris on the tarmac as their planes arrived at about the same time in Wisconsin.
summary: Republican vice-presidential candidate and Ohio Senator JD Vance tried to confront Vice President Kamala Harris on the tarmac as their planes arrived at about the same time in Wisconsin.

title: July 2024 Sees 2 Warmest Days Ever Becomes Second Hottest Month On Record
content: Last month was the second hottest July for the planet on record, breaking a 13-month period when each month was warmest, which had been in part fuelled by the warming El Nino weather pattern.
summary: Last month was the second hottest July for the planet on record, breaking a 13-month period when each month was warmest, which had been in part fuelled by the warming El Nino weather pattern.

title: South Carolina Anticipates Deluge As Hurricane Debby Makes Landfall
content: Tropical Storm Debby is forecast to make landfall early Thursday and dump even more rain on the South Carolina coast, prompting fears of flash flooding in areas already soaked by the slow-moving weather system.
summary: Tropical Storm Debby is forecast to make landfall early Thursday and dump even more rain on the South Carolina coast, prompting fears of flash flooding in areas already soaked by the slow-moving weather system.

title: Sunita Williams Went To Space For 8 Days, But Could Be Stuck Till Feb 2025
content: What was meant to be a 10-day mission to the International Space Station (ISS) for the first NASA astronauts - Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams - to fly with Boeing could extend to eight months.
summary: What was meant to be a 10-day mission to the International Space Station (ISS) for the first NASA astronauts - Butch Wilmore and Sunita Williams - to fly with Boeing could extend to eight months.

title: Iran Woman Jailed For Singing In Public Without Hijab, Whereabouts Unknown
content: This arrest is the latest example of Iran's strict enforcement of the mandatory hijab laws, which human rights activists have widely criticised.
summary: This arrest is the latest example of Iran's strict enforcement of the mandatory hijab laws, which human rights activists have widely criticised.

title: Why Anti-Immigration Protests And Riots Are Sweeping Across The UK
content: A wave of riots, sparked by a deadly attack at a children's dance event and further fueled by a torrent of misinformation, has gripped parts of the United Kingdom.
summary: A wave of riots, sparked by a deadly attack at a children's dance event and further fueled by a torrent of misinformation, has gripped parts of the United Kingdom.

title: "Unstable Situation": Indian Visa Centres In Bangladesh Closed Indefinitely
content: All Indian visa application centres in Bangladesh will remain closed until further notice after unrest in the neighbouring country forced Sheikh Hasina to resign as Prime Minister and flee the country.
summary: All Indian visa application centres in Bangladesh will remain closed until further notice after unrest in the neighbouring country forced Sheikh Hasina to resign as Prime Minister and flee the country.

title: Actor Shanto Khan, His Father Lynched During Unrest In Bangladesh
content: Actor Shanto Khan was lynched at Chandpur along with his father Selim Khan, owner of a renowned Bangladeshi production house.
summary: Actor Shanto Khan was lynched at Chandpur along with his father Selim Khan, owner of a renowned Bangladeshi production house.

title: "Heartbroken That I Can't See, Hug Her": Sheikh Hasina's Daughter
content: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's daughter today said she was "heartbroken" that she could not "see and hug her mother" after her ouster.
summary: Former Bangladesh Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's daughter today said she was "heartbroken" that she could not "see and hug her mother" after her ouster.

title: Bangladesh Set To Get Interim Government Led By Nobel Winner Today
content: Bangladesh is set to get an interim government headed by Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus today, days after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was forced to resign amid violent student protests.
summary: Bangladesh is set to get an interim government headed by Nobel Peace Prize-winning economist Muhammad Yunus today, days after Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina was forced to resign amid violent student protests.

title: Anti-Racism Protests Erupt In UK Amid Unrest After Far-Right Demonstrations
content: Thousands of anti-racism protesters have taken to the streets in many cities and towns of the UK to counter far-right demonstrations after days of unrest following Southport stabbing.
summary: Thousands of anti-racism protesters have taken to the streets in many cities and towns of the UK to counter far-right demonstrations after days of unrest following Southport stabbing.

title: Bangladesh New Interim PM Muhammad Yunus Heads Home, To Be Sworn In Today
content: Nobel Laureate economist Muhammad Yunus is expected to return to Bangladesh on Thursday, Bangladesh-based Dhaka Tribune reported.
summary: Nobel Laureate economist Muhammad Yunus is expected to return to Bangladesh on Thursday, Bangladesh-based Dhaka Tribune reported.
